result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs as to count one.  DNA surcharge waived on count two due to surcharge being imposed on count one.
Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.  DOC shall collect funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by DOC.  Remaining balnce to be collected during the period of Extended Supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count four; and concurrent with Federal sentence. Credit for 612 days.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one; and concurrent with Federal sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (33 pages) commencing 9/20/2016 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.  vk
Original Transcript (18 pages) commencing 9/22/2016 CONTINUED SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.  vk

Defendant Michael J Riley in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Defendant Michael J Riley in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court for continuation of sentencing hearing from 9/20/16 held.  Court finds that State has complied with victim notification for today's date.  Sentencing hearing proceeds.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 4 and CONCURRENT to federal sentence), with credit for 612 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1 and CONCURRENT to federal sentence); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs (AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY).  Due to DNA surcharge being imposed on COUNT 1, Court orders DNA surcharge WAIVED as to COUNT 4. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
- (undated) from Kimberly Slade, filed.

Attorney Michael Hart in court, defendant Michael J Riley not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Additionally, defense requests matter be adjourned until after federal case is completed (after 8/4/16).  Court grants request, sentencing hearing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Riley in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Defendant Michael J Riley in Federal custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 35
AS to counts 1 and 4:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Counts 2 and 3 are ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.  Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 7-12-2016 at 1:30pm  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum received and filed.

Court adjourns hearing, defendant to be produced on next date.  New trial date to be selected with defendant present on next date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel contacts the Court.  State and defense are requesting removal of 6/13/16 jury trial date.  ADA Kolberg has another matter set for firm trial on that date.  Court authorizes trial date to be vacated.  New trial date to be selected on next date.

Final pre-trial scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
